segments.text: Honestly, I can't stand to look at this kitchen for much longer.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The sheer waste of water is infuriating; it's just gushing everywhere.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: How can someone be so completely blind to a literal flood in front of them?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: That woman is just standing there, placidly drying a dish while her kitchen becomes a swimming pool.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s a disgusting mess, all that water seeping into the cabinets and floorboards.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Then you have those children, completely unsupervised and causing mischief.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: They’re practically destroying the place with their cookie heist.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: That stool is going to tip, and someone is going to get hurt, I just know it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's an utterly preventable disaster, and it's making my blood boil.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Who leaves a faucet running and walks away without a care in the world?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This whole scene is a testament to negligence and lack of attention.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I just want to turn off that faucet myself and tell everyone to pay attention!
segments.speaker: PAR
